*If you have any questions or concerns you may contact Superintendent Arleen Kennedy akennedy@stdavid.org or Principal Andrew Brogan abrogan@stdavid.org.

Please remember that the best way to combat this and any illness is to take proactive precautions of cleanliness and testing if you believe you have any symptoms. Please be safe.

Our administration would like to extend the opportunity for parents of children in grade levels with multiple teachers to request a teacher for next school year. Requests must be submitted in writing, and will be accepted May 1-May 31, 2019. Let us know what kind of teacher you think is best for your child and give your input to help us find the best fit for your child. We reserve the right to honor or deny parental requests for specific teachers based on a variety of factors.

If your child is at or above grade level and has no specific social or academic needs, you may not need to complete a teacher request for your child. Our administration prefers to place the children to help the classrooms be balanced and provide the best opportunity for success while fostering a learning environment.

Our elementary grade levels with multiple teachers 2019-20: Kindergarten – Ms. Corley, Mrs. Pritchard; 1st Grade – Mrs. Watts, Mrs. Judd; 5th Grade – Mrs. Davidson, Miss Poole.

Check out this note from the new Ag teacher, Mrs. Rebekah Wright-

Good Morning!

I hope that you all had a wonderful weekend! This past Friday we took 10 FFA member to Curry Farms to participate in the annual FFA Chile Field Day. Students were tested on their Knowledge on the following: Soil, Plant Breeding and Genetics, Processing Plant Management, Chile Seed, Chile Pod and Chile Crop Production, and Disease Identification. Our students represented St. David well as we placed 3rd in the TEAM Written exam and received a plaque for this achievement. Additionally, a senior was recognized and received a trophy for placing 3rd high individual in the written exam. Lastly, at the field day there was a HOT Chile eating competition and our Jonah Lewis went home with 3rd place and $50 dollars in his pocket!

I am thankful to work with such wonderful students. I look forward to the year we have ahead of us to challenge our students and celebrate their achievements. Attached are some photos from the event. Please enjoy.

Respectfully,

Rebekah L. Wright

***Calendar Change-Early Release***

Beginning in the Spring Semester (January) St. David Unified will be moving to an early release every Wednesday. We will maintain one half-day each month for professional development. All other Wednesdays will be an early release at 2:00 PM for Middle and High School Students. There will be no change for Elementary students on these days.

The purpose of this change is to provide our staff the time for their team meetings and Professional Learning during the contractual day. To improve our instruction and curriculum teachers have begun to meet in weekly meetings to review student performance and curriculum in an attempt to close gaps and identify areas to enhance our curriculum and instruction based on evidence linked to data.

We anticipate that there may be some middle school athletes that will not be able to go home and make it back for their team practice. There will be a study room open for these students on these early release days.

If you have questions please feel free to contact the school office.
